title: Sri Lanka stocks plunge 6.6-pct at open
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s main stock index slipped 6.6 percent on Monday and opening after a 7 percent rate hike, a two-week holiday in which period the central bank announced a soft-default and began IMF discussions.
The ASPI was 500 points down at 7,593.39 as soon as the market opened.
Most liquid index S&P SL20 also fell over 7.06 percent within minutes after market started trading.
Trading was halted and the Colombo Stock Exchange said trading will resume at 11.01 am.
The stock exchange has circuit breakers at 5.0 percent, 7.5 percent and 10.00 percent after which the market is closed. (Colombo/April/2022)
